> LGTM.
> 
> It seems we don't need to calculate the `| machineId << MACHINE_LEFT` in line 73 every time? I am not sure if java compiler will do this optimization, but it should be a constant?

I think it should not be a constant, this is related to the current machine, `MACHINE_BIT = 2` can support four machines of api server

> > LGTM.
> > It seems we don't need to calculate the `| machineId << MACHINE_LEFT` in line 73 every time? I am not sure if java compiler will do this optimization, but it should be a constant?
> 
> I think it should not be a constant, this is related to the current machine, `MACHINE_BIT = 2` can support four machines of api server

Yes, I mean when we can calculate in the constructor, and then we can avoid calculate in each time execute nextId.
This is not a problem, this does not affect performance.

> > > LGTM.
> > > It seems we don't need to calculate the `| machineId << MACHINE_LEFT` in line 73 every time? I am not sure if java compiler will do this optimization, but it should be a constant?

> > I think it should not be a constant, this is related to the current machine, `MACHINE_BIT = 2` can support four machines of api server

> Yes, I mean when we can calculate in the constructor, and then we can avoid calculate in each time execute nextId. This is not a problem, this does not affect performance.

You're right, can you contribute a new PR to optimize it ?

Could we avoid using `System.out.println` in test by checkstyle.xml? If so that would be great!

### Search before asking

- [X] I had searched in the [issues](https://github.com/apache/dolphinscheduler/issues?q=is%3Aissue) and found no similar issues.


### What happened

When rerunning a task, the running time of the task is counted from the last end time,the statistical time is error. 
When the rerunning task ends, the statistical time is correct. 

### What you expected to happen

Suggestion: 
trigger rerun, and count from the current time during task operation, otherwise it is easy to cause misunderstanding.
